messages.content:
Hello! Could you please explain me the reducer's API.

1) What is the difference between `getActions` and `fetchActions`.  Does `fetchActions` work with archived nodes wheres `getActions` with the chain?
2) What is the pointer to the action history?
3) What is the `maxTransactionsWithActions` field?
4) What is the `skipActionStatePrecondition` field?

Thank you
1) Looks like it is just a helper method that allow us to fetch actions in circuit. Can we say that `getActions` works the same as the `fetchActions`, but in circuit?
1) yes
2) not sure what you're asking
3 and 4) check out the doccomment! Happy to help if you have more questions
Could you share the docs with the description please, because I have not found.
Did you take a look at this? https://docs.minaprotocol.com/zkapps/o1js/actions-and-reducer

embeds.title: Mina Documentation
embeds.description: Website for documentation about Mina Protocol

messages.content: Yes, i did, there is no info about  maxTransactions and skipActionStatePreconditions

`maxTransactionsWithActions` lets you adjust the maximum number of actions to reduce at once, which is set to 32 by default <https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/blob/main/src/lib/zkapp.ts#L1356> we need this because we can't dynamically reduce a dynamic sized list
`skipActionStatePrecondition` lets you skip the precondition assertion on the account, see <https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/blob/main/src/lib/zkapp.ts#L1413>
we should add this to the docs, I tought we already had that
What is the max number of actions we can reduce at once?
Is contract.account.actionState  is a hash of all produced actions?
Hey @magestrio, easiest way to find doccomments is by hovering over the function name in an editor that supports it
Unfortunately, it does not work for my case as the description for the fields I am asking does not exist. However, if I looked at the source code, I would understand these fields better - my bad.
I will extend a bit my question: How the actions are represented in the storage so that we can slice by using `fromActionState` + `endActionState`.
Oh oops sorry 😅
Actions are represented on the account only as a hash, which represents all actions that were dispatched so far. The actual actions aren't stored there.

A frequent pattern to get a second pointer into the history is the use one of the state fields for the action state hash which represents actions that were already processed. So that you know where the "pending" actions start. So,. you use that state field as the fromActionState

Thanks. These answers are really helpful for me to extend my vision on this feature!

I still have two questions:
1) The actions are stored on the archive node. Which data structure is used to store them, so that we can retrieve a certain part of the actions by using the processed hashes.
2) What is the max number of actions we can reduce at once?  (what is the max value for `maxTransactionsWithActions`)
2) there is no hard max value for this. But the circuit size is limited. So there will be a max but it depends on how much provable logic you have per action

1) not sure how they are stored. I vaguely remember that currently the graphql query just returns all actions (and they are filtered client side) but there was a plan to store the action states as well
I am good. Thank you
